content: The #TempleofHeaven served as a sacred space for Ming and Qing emperors to pray for bountiful harvests. In this episode of "#Beijing: #MoreThanMeetstheEye," Zhao Chengwei introduces the ancient #sanxian, blending architectural marvels and traditional #music.

The #MingCityWallRuinsPark holds some of #Beijing’s best Ming Dynasty relics. In #spring, plum blossoms bloom, drawing flower fans. Stroll the wall, feel history meet nature, and soak in the ancient capital’s charm. #NatureAndHistory #BeijingSpring #VisitBeijing
#Shichahai is one of #Beijing’s most charming lakes year-round. As the sun sets, the reflection on the water complements the ancient architecture, creating a truly stunning scene. #VisitBeijing

As #Xiaoman (#GrainBuds) marks nature's growth, Qingfeng #Park, in the heart of #Beijing's #CBD, offers a peaceful escape. Along the #TonghuiRiver, blooming roses line an old railway track, beautifully contrasting with industrial relics. #BeijingParks #SolarTerms #VisitBeijing

Tucked away in Sanjing #Hutong near #Qianmen, Naga Tree Coffee is #Beijing’s first #barrierfree #coffeeshop. The café features an industrial-style design, and includes a terrace. It’s the perfect spot to enjoy coffee, desserts, and literary salons or reading clubs. #VisitBeijing

Wangfujing Street lights up at night, buzzing with neon in one of #Beijing's most iconic commercial districts. The historic street shines under the night sky, as brightly lit shops and vibrant billboards create an electric shopping vibe. #WangfujingStreet #VisitBeijing

Immerse yourself in the serene beauty of #HuanghuachengLakesideGreatWall this #autumn! As the leaves transform into vibrant hues, the tranquil waters reflect the stunning landscape, creating a mesmerizing scene that whispers tales of history and nature. #GreatWall #VisitBeijing

Yuanmingyuan Station on #BeijingSubway Line 4 is near the south gate of #Yuanmingyuan Park (#OldSummerPalace). The station’s design incorporates cultural elements, with sculptures in the hall highlighting the grandeur of this historic imperial garden. #VisitBeijing

Immerse yourself in the elegance of #Hanfu with a unique experience in #Beijing! In this episode of "#BeijingExpatTravelGuide," Join expat Rachel as foreigners step into the beauty of traditional attire, exploring ancient culture in modern times. #VisitBeijing

Dongsi Shitiao Station connects #BeijingSubway Lines 2 & 3 in Dongcheng District. Modern design and traditional elements, like #CentralAxis wall art, make it more than a hub—it’s a window into #Beijing’s essence for tourists. #VisitBeijing

The National Centre for the Performing Arts (#NCPA) is a cultural hub in #China, hosting world-class performances. Recognized for its exceptional design, it stands as a landmark in #Beijing. #BeijingArchitecture #VisitBeijing

Guo Moruo's Former Residence reflects the writer and historian’s achievements in literature, history, and archaeology. Surrounded by lush greenery, the serene courtyard invites visitors to pause and reflect on his legacy. #VisitBeijing

Yongdingmen, the southernmost point of #Beijing's #CentralAxis, was built in 1553 during the Ming Dynasty. The name means "eternal stability" and has witnessed the vicissitudes of time. Visit the rebuilt Yongdingmen Tower for its timeless historical charm. #VisitBeijing

What images come to mind when thinking of #Beijing? On October 19, the "Hello, Beijing" photography exhibition opened at the #ChinaMillenniumMonument, featuring over 200 works that showcase the city’s rich cultural tourism resources. #PhotographyExhibition #VisitBeijing

#XuanwumenChurch, built in 1605 by Matteo Ricci, is one of #Beijing's oldest Catholic churches. Its Baroque architecture mixes Western and local styles. At #Christmas, the church hosts a grand tree and festive decor, filling the space with warmth and joy. #VisitBeijing

Beneath #Beijing's #spring sun, #magnolias grace Donghua Gate of the #ForbiddenCity. Their pink petals harmonize with the red palace walls, weaving a scene that lingers uniquely in this season and in Beijing alone. #VisitBeijing #WorldTravel

Nestled in central #Beijing, the #LamaTemple is a peaceful sanctuary. One of the city’s most famous Tibetan Buddhist temples, it stands as a crossroads of history and culture. Stroll through the temple and experience the fusion of modern and traditional Beijing. #VisitBeijing

Join the "#GreatWallHero" campaign! Share your photos of the #GreatWall, #Beijing, or the #CentralAxis in the comments and tell us your story. We’ll feature top entries on ! Don’t miss this chance to showcase your adventure to the world. #ChinaTravel #VisitBeijing

Shougang Songlin #Park, located in Shijingshan District, features lush pine forests. It also houses a quiet cultural space, offering a calm setting for reading and reflection, surrounded by nature. #BeijingParks #NatureInTheCity #BeijingLife #VisitBeijing #Beijing

The celebration at the #ChinaEthnicMuseum, themed around China’s multi-ethnic groups, is a spectacular event that merges ethnic culture, lighting art, and modern technology. During the #LanternFestival, it has become a key highlight of the festivities in #Beijing. #VisitBeijing

#Beijing's #CentralAxis extends northward, where the #BirdsNest and #WaterCube stand as modern landmarks reflecting the city’s #OlympicLegacy. These buildings highlight the new face of this ancient capital and blend technology with art. #VisitBeijing

The China Medical History #Museum, located in Dongcheng District, houses valuable collections, including imperial medical manuscripts, rare books, rubbings, and artworks, illustrating the history and development of Chinese medicine. #TCM #VisitBeijing #Beijing

The #MajorSnow, one of the 24 #solarterms in the traditional Chinese calendar, marks the arrival of deeper winter. In #Beijing, the #ForbiddenCity under a blanket of snow becomes a stunning masterpiece, blending ancient architecture with serene winter beauty. #VisitBeijing

At #Zhushikou Station, the cultural wall design blends "beam frames and colored paintings," using the golden line composition technique to create a textured relief for a unique visual experience. #BeijingSubway #VisitBeijing

#Beijing's #CentralAxis, which was initially constructed during the Yuan Dynasty and was completed during the Ming Dynasty, stretches 7.8 kilometers from the #BellandDrumTowers on the north to #Yongdingmen on the south. #ExploreBeijing #BeijingTourism #VisitBeijing

#Qianmen Street in #Beijing epitomizes the city's rich heritage, history, and culture, inviting you to appreciate its historical architecture, embrace the fusion of culture and leisure in this ancient capital, and relish the simple joys of life in Beijing. #VisitBeijing

Aligned with the National Centre for the Performing Arts' commitment to "high quality and high standards," the Beijing Performing Arts Centre, located by the historic #GrandCanal, warmly welcomes art enthusiasts to explore its enriching space. #Tongzhou #VisitBeijing

#ChinaRailwayMuseum #Zhengyangmen Branch, situated southeast of Tiananmen Square, chronicles China's #railway development from 1876, highlighting its impressive advancements since the founding of the PRC. #BeijingMuseums #VisitBeijing #Beijing

#FayuanTemple is one of the oldest temples in #Beijing. Its grand, symmetrical layout, ancient trees, steles, and solemn Buddha statues create an ideal spot for meditation and appreciating the charm of this 1,000-year-old #landmark. #VisitBeijing

Shuangxiu #Park in Xicheng District, #Beijing, features a harmonious blend of garden styles. With charming pavilions, bridges, and flowing water, it’s a serene escape for locals and tourists. Enjoy a stroll or tea while taking in the beautiful scenery. #VisitBeijing

The #CapitalGrainMuseum takes visitors from ancient farming civilizations to modern agricultural technology. Farming tools, grain coupons, and storage models highlight the evolution of food production, fostering appreciation for food, nature, and a better future. #VisitBeijing

Celebrate the #MidAutumnFestival at the #BellandDrumTower with drum-beating and bell-ringing performances, along with a time-themed parade linking ancient and modern times, making this deeply cherished Chinese festival truly unforgettable! #VisitBeijing

Shijingshan #Amusement Park is where fun meets charm, with its European castle architecture, stunning #Ferriswheel views, and classic attractions like the carousel and family roller coaster. The park also hosts themed events and exhibitions for added excitement. #VisitBeijing

#Chegongzhuang Station serves as a interchange for #BeijingSubway Line 2 and Line 6. The station hall features a mural inspired by #BeijingOpera costumes, reflecting the cultural heritage of the area, and paying tribute to the nearby #MeiLanfang Grand Theater, a notable landmark.

Daguanying Station is a key interchange for Line 7 and Line 16 of the #BeijingSubway. The Line 16 platform features a thematic design inspired by ancient #Beijing, blending "teahouses" and "drama stages" for an immersive experience celebrating the city's cultural heritage.

Huode Zhenjun #Temple is in the #Shichahai neighborhood of #Beijing. Built in the Tang Dynasty, this #Taoist temple was rebuilt and expanded through the Yuan, Ming, and Qing dynasties. Situated on the #CentralAxis, it offers rich historical and cultural insights. #VisitBeijing

Originally built in the Yuan Dynasty, #HongenTemple underwent multiple reconstructions during the Ming and Qing dynasties. Located along #Beijing's #CentralAxis, it offers insights into ancient Chinese religious architecture, making it a notable attraction. #VisitBeijing

The #CapitalMuseum is a comprehensive hub for exhibition, research, archaeology, education, and cultural exchange. Its extensive collection provides insights into #Beijing's culture and history, making it ideal for exploring the city's rich past. #VisitBeijing

Jingyun Garden, in Xicheng District, #Beijing, celebrates the rich heritage of #BeijingOpera. The garden's design highlights the cultural essence of this art form, illustrating the evolution of opera and integrating its cultural elements into a unique cultural belt. #VisitBeijing

#Nanluoguxiang Station connects #BeijingSubway Line 6 and Line 8, adjacent to the #courtyard residential area. The station's main wall decoration, featuring ancient bricks, harmonizes with the nearby historic neighborhood, enhancing its distinctive architectural style. #Beijing

Aosen Park Reading Library, tucked away in the bamboo woods of #OlympicForestPark, is a stylish #bookstore with a glass curtain wall that invites nature indoors. Today is #WhiteDew, the third #solarterm of autumn, so take a break and check out this cozy spot! #VisitBeijing

Today is the #LabaFestival in northern #China, featuring customary #LabaCongee with ingredients like rice, millet, red beans, mung beans, red dates, and peanuts. Celebrating marks the start of the #ChineseNewYear. #VisitBeijing #Beijing

PhDr. Josef Hejzlar (1927-2012) was a renowned Czech art historian, sinologist, translatorand writer. He had the opportunity to meet Mr. Qi Baishi during his studies in China. In 1955, Qi Baishi gifted Hejzlar with a beautiful briar, painted with exceptional skill. #visitbeijing

Tanxi Scenic Spot is a waterfront #park steeped in ancient charm, inspired by a poem about Jishuitan from the 26th year of Emperor Qianlong's reign in the Qing Dynasty. It's a perfect spot to unwind and enjoy tranquility, shining as a gem among #Beijing's parks. #VisitBeijing

#Daoxiangcun, a time-honored #pastry #shop, has recently opened a new pilot #store that showcases the #24solarterms of the #Chineselunarcalendar. The pastries are not only delectable but also rich in unique shapes and whimsical designs. #VisitBeijing

The Ditan #BookFair at #DitanPark gathers over 330 publishing institutions, bookstores, presenting 400,000 books and setting a new record. This fair celebrates reading enthusiasts and highlights #Beijing's cultural tourism. #VisitBeijing

The Dazhong Temple Ancient Bell Museum is a unique museum with a multifaceted mission to collect, preserve, display, research and utilize ancient clocks. The museum's crown jewel is the Yongle Big Bell, cast during the Yongle era of the Ming Dynasty around 1420. #visitbeijing

The Beijing Fine Art Academy houses a vast collection of Qi Baishi's copies of Bada Shanren's works. Through these pieces, we can witness Bada Shanren's influence on Qi Baishi and appreciate how Chinese art is passed down from one generation to the next. #visitbeijing

Recently, the #LiangmaRiver's Style #Waterfront served as the backdrop for the "Own Your Style" #fashionshow. The event created an engaging experience that immersed the audience in #Beijing's #fashion scene. #VisitBeijing

Tianning Temple is among the oldest surviving temples in Beijing. Its brick pagoda with overlapping eaves is a great example of traditional architecture. The temple offers a peaceful and serene atmosphere, making it an ideal place for relaxation and contemplation. #visitbeijing

The Chinese Ethnic Culture Park is situated in the southern part of the Olympic Park in Beijing. It is a vast cultural hub that combines cultural exhibitions, singing and dancing performances, traditional housing displays, as well as artistic craftsmanship. #visitbeijing

On the day of #Chushu (#EndofHeat), Changchunyuan (the Garden of Eternal Spring) in the #OldSummerPalace offers a “guochao”-style (Chinese traditional and vintage) #afternoon tea, creating an experience that combines artistry with cultural flavor. #VisitBeijing

The #ChinaNumismaticsMuseum is located in the Xicheng District of #Beijing and was established in 1992. It houses a collection of more than 300,000 #ancient and #modern #Chinese and foreign #coins, as well as other cultural #relics related to coins. #VisitBeijing

Bloomage (Huaxi) LIVE, adjacent to the West Fourth Ring Road in the west of Beijing, is a popular place where one can see the vibrant commercial side of the capital. It’s a particularly popular destination for many young people. #Beijinglandmarks #visitbeijing #Olympicvenues

#GreatWallHero #BeijingCentralAxis #CentralAxis #Beijing #beijinghistory #beijinglandmarks #ThePalaceMuseum The Palace Museum, Dongcheng District Photographed by CHEN Fenglin Image Source：Competition for the Transmission and Promotion of Beijing Central Axis

The Beijing Wildlife Park, located in Daxing District approximately 50 kilometers south of the city center of Beijing, is situated along the Yongding River. This natural ecological park serves as a premier destination for tourists seeking to observe wild animals. #visitbeijing

Today’s special recommendation is the Capital Museum, a uniquely comprehensive and modern museum. In this grandeur architecture combining classical and modern beauty, you’ll have a great opportunity to look into Beijing’s evolvement through many excellent exhibits. #VisitBeijing

#GreatWallHero #BeijingCentralAxis #CentralAxis #beijinghistory #beijingculture #OnlyInBeijing #TempleofHeaven #Tiantan Temple of Heaven, Dongcheng District Photographed by ZHU Yusheng Image Source：Competition for the Transmission and Promotion of Beijing Central Axis

Built more than 100 years ago, Tai'anli is Beijing's last standing example of a Shanghainese style of architecture. The dilapidated roof, ancient brickwork and broken windows starkly contrast with the structures that surround it. #visitbeijing

Dongsi Hutong #Museum highlights #hutong life and the spirit of the historic capital. Through multimedia exhibits, cultural relics, and interactive displays, it shows the evolution of hutongs and daily life in #Beijing over the centuries. #BeijingMuseums #VisitBeijing

Beitou Aoyuan 1314, located along the #centralaxis near the #Olympic Sports Center, is where sports and culture converge, reflecting the dual Olympic city legacy. It is ideal for a family outing or a gathering with friends, offering a rich and diverse experience in #Beijing.

Experience the beauty of #Beijing's outdoor #scenery this #summer as you ride your #bike through enchanting landscapes. Begin your journey at #LiuyinPier. Meander through #LuyangBridge and other captivating spots before reaching the #ThreeTemplesandOnePagoda. #VisitBeijing

Qi Baishi, a master of modern Chinese art, has a cherry painting that is part of the collection of the Beijing Fine Art Academy. Similarly, artists such as Jacob van Hulsdonck have produced still life paintings featuring fruits and vegetables, including cherries. #visitbeijing

#GreatWallHero #BeijingCentralAxis #CentralAxis #beijingsight #beijingattraction #beijinglife #visitbeijing #DrumTower Drum Tower, Dongcheng District Photographed by ZHU Yunxia Image Source：Competition for the Transmission and Promotion of Beijing Central Axis

The Palace Museum within the Forbidden City was first established in 1925. The museum holds paintings, calligraphy, ceramics and antiquities of the imperial collections. In 1987, it was listed as a UNESCO World Heritage site. #ForbiddenCity #UNESCOWorldHeritagesite
The Urban Oasis Trendy #Lifestyle #Festival was recently held at #491Space. Attendees enthusiastically participated in activities like frisbee and enjoyed the excitement of #sports. #VisitBeijing

The boat sightseeing project along the #Tongzhou section of the #GrandCanal has always been well-loved. A special night #cruise for the #summer season has recently been launched. Feeling the gentle breeze, this is truly a unique experience. #VisitBeijing

Distinguished guests from over 20 countries attended the Art Salon for Diplomatic Envoys—Xiangshan Midsummer Night at Fragrant Hills Park. The serene gardens provided a backdrop to the delightful tea, enchanting opera, fostering cultural exchange and appreciation. #VisitBeijing

As the #NewYear approaches and heavy #snow falls, people continue to come and go at the #LamaTemple. It serves as a place for devout Buddhist believers to pray, worship, and study Buddhist teachings, attracting numerous visitors who come to explore. #CapitalCharm #VisitBeijing

The “Bravo to Beijing: Culture Tour of Beijing Opera Special Exhibition” at the 2023 China International Fair for Trade in Services (#CIFTIS) provided the audience with a unique cultural exploration of the world of #BeijingOpera.

Tima, an international student in China, has been vlogging his life in Beijing since 2021. He plans to travel more around China in the new year to explore the diversity of the country. #beijinglife #beijingcity #vlog

"The #GreatWall #Dragon" is a work that won the first prize in the product category of the Global #Zodiac #Design Competition (Jiachen #YearoftheDragon). The author integrates the Great Wall and the dragon, two of the most representative and symbolic cultural icons of #China.

At the "Happy #ChineseNewYear" event in #Estonia, the globally popular "#SubjectThree" #dance, elevated the entire show to its peak. The simple yet captivating dances ignited the enthusiasm of the audience, reflecting the expanding influence of Chinese culture.
#ChangyingPark's expansive #ginkgoforest turns into a golden masterpiece every #autumn. Discover this serene haven where #ginkgo trees paint the sky gold. #VisitBeijing

Against the backdrop of the lush green mountains of Beijing Songshan Natural Reserve, Club Med Joyview Yanqing is a leisure resort. This picturesque area of the Chinese capital looks even more beautiful blanketed under a layer of white snow — a scene to be admired. #visitbeijing

The “Enjoy ICH” Music Experience Day, part of the “Hello, #Beijing!” in-depth cultural program, unfolded at #ZhihuaTemple, where the #courtyard offered a delightful ambiance for attendees to embrace #Chinesetea art, #cloisonné, #calligraphy, #rubbings, and more. #VisitBeijing

#Hutongs in #Beijing are not only the veins of the city but also a vital stage in the evolution of its history and culture. The #ConfuciusTemple, the #Yonghegong #LamaTemple, and the #Ditan Park have become cultural symbols integrated into the lives of old Beijing's residents.

On Sept 12, “Bravo to #Beijing: Culture Tour of #BeijingOpera” debuted at #CIFTIS in #ShougangPark! Featuring a full moon installation, #MeiLanfang photo exhibit, tea tasting, and interactive zones, it’s an immersive Beijing Opera experience blending tradition and innovation.

Asian beats meet Central & Eastern Europe’s passion! The 4th China-CEEC Culture & Arts Carnival lights up the summer solstice, June 20–22, at Hall 12 (Vast Lawn), #Shougang, #Beijing. Don’t miss it! #ChinaCEEC #CultureAndArts #BeijingEvents #VisitBeijing

Close to the #DrumTower, there's a new "go-to spot" that's attracting a lot of attention. It's called Drum Tower Park, a fresh cultural and creative venue on Gulou Dongdajie. This spot is popular among influencers and tourists alike, so it's definitely worth checking out.

Constructed in the mid-17th century, #XihuangTemple embodies the rich history of Tibetan-Han cultural exchange. Its standout feature, the Qingjing Huacheng #Pagoda, is one of #Beijing's four remaining Vajra Throne-style pagodas and a true architectural masterpiece. #VisitBeijing

This is one of #Beijing's quirkiest and most beloved alleyways. Even the name, Yandaixiejie or “Pipe and Tobacco Crooked Lane” offers a hint of the unique character of this #hutong. #Travel #WorldTravel

The #MiaofengMountain #Temple #Fair is a cherished traditional #folk activity deeply rooted in ancient #customs. Continuously celebrated and maintaining significant influence, the fair embodies the traditional auspicious culture associated with folk beliefs. #VisitBeijing

The Beijing Overseas Cultural Exchange Center held the event “Culture Tour of #BeijingOpera: The Grandeur of Beijing Opera” in #Beijing. The event was attended by board members and women entrepreneurs representing the BRICS Women’s Business Alliance (WBA) from various countries.

Huang Yongyu's New Works #Exhibition officially opened at the #NationalArtMuseumofChina on June 25. This exhibition features 159 new works from #HuangYongyu's later years, providing a comprehensive display of his creative state and artistic pursuits after the age of 90. #Beijing

#Beijing's summer heat is intense, but coolness awaits! Stroll along #YanqiLake, feel the breeze by the rippling waves. Cruise the #BeijingHangzhouGrandCanal, where history meets modernity. Hike #BaiquanMountain for fresh, tranquil nature. #NatureEscape #VisitBeijing

In the Global #Zodiac #Design Competition, Good Fortune to the #DragonYear and the Rainbow Auspicious Dragon stand out with the unique designs. They perfectly blend traditional Chinese patterns with dragon elements, showcasing profound #traditionalculture. #Beijing #VisitBeijing

Celebrate the 10th anniversary of the #GrandCanal’s UNESCO recognition at the 2024 #Beijing International Canal Arts Fest! From Oct 2-4, join global artists at Funstown, Chaoyang District, for an exciting journey through canal culture and a stunning international art showcase.

Near the #ForbiddenCity, the iconic #RedBuildingofPekingUniversity, constructed in 1916 from red bricks and red tiles, stands tall. In #autumn, this site is perfect for embracing the season, brimming with history and humanity. #VisitBeijing

The #Beijing Overseas Cultural Exchange Center is hosting the 2024 Global #Zodiac #Design Competition Invitational #Exhibition. In addition to the award-winning works, the exhibition features zodiac #artworks by renowned artists. Come and witness the splendor! #VisitBeijing

The Global #Zodiac #Design Competition is a renowned cultural event that has been held for ten consecutive years. "The Red #Lantern #Dragon" is a work that draws inspiration from the shape of lanterns and incorporates the image of the Chinese dragon in its design.
Just a quick correction: Madian Park is actually in Haidian District, Beijing.

#WofoTemple, also known as the Reclining Buddha Temple, is nestled in #HaidianDistrict, #Beijing. Its architectural layout provides invaluable insights into the development and evolution of ancient Chinese Buddhist temples. #BeijingBeyond #VisitBeijing

The first #solarterm of #winter—#Lidong (Start of Winter) has arrived! Today, we will fully experience the delicious flavors of #Beijing's #intangibleculturalheritage, including #lambhotpot, pickled vegetables, and other classic local dishes. #WinterDelicacies #VisitBeijing

From Jan 20 to 24, the "Hello, Beijing" inbound tourism promotion series was successfully held in Turkey. The event showcased #Beijing's unique charm as a historic cultural city and a global travel destination. #InboundTourism #CulturalHeritage #TourismPromotion #VisitBeijing

The address is No. 217, Xiaoguan Beili Street, Chaoyang District, Beijing. You can take Subway Line 10, get off at Huixin Xijie Nankou Station, exit from Exit A, and walk for about 13 minutes to arrive. This is not near 798.
Beijing is a city that fascinates lots of people. Welcome to Beijing.
Yes. Appreciates your regular visits to our page. Stay tuned for more from us.
Thank you for sharing your excitement! Exhibitions like this truly help connect us to the rich heritage and traditions of China.
Thanks for your comment. Good luck in the Year of the Rabbit.
